page.title: 01Fenland SW of Spalding
page.content: This area is mainly farmland. The A16 trunk road passes through from Spalding to Market Deeping. The people mostly live in houses near to this road and either work on local farms or travel by car, bus or train to Spalding or Peterborough to work in offices, shops or factories. The only other housing is farm houses usually reached by farm roads leading from the the minor roads crossing the area. The landscape is very flat and drainage dykes are a feature of this type of land on which sugar beet and cereal crops are mainly grown. The River Welland also passes through part of this section and a feature of this is the high banks formed to stop flooding. The banks provide occasional grazing for cattle. The rail link between Spalding and Peterborough is also seen crossing this section.
